member.name: InputScope
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify which input scopes are applied to a given field.

member.name: InputScope.IS_DEFAULT
member.summary: Indicates the standard recognition bias. Treated as default and uses the default lexicon. If combined with another input scope, it does not force coercion on the other input scope.

summary.para: Indicates a URL, File, or FTP format. Examples include the following.

member.name: InputScope.IS_FILE_FULLFILEPATH
member.summary:
Indicates a file path. The following conditions are enforced.
For server name and share name, allows all IS_ONECHAR characters except: * ? : < > |
For file name, allows all IS_ONECHAR characters except: \ / : < > |
Input must start with \\ or drive name or \ or ..\ or .\ or /
Spaces are allowed.
Examples include the following.
\\servername\sharename\filename.txt
C:\temp\current work.doc
../images/hank.jpg

member.name: InputScope.IS_FILE_FILENAME
member.summary:
Indicates a file name. The following conditions are enforced.
Accepts either extension or no extension.
Allows all IS_ONECHAR characters except: \ / : < > |
Spaces are allowed.
Examples include the following:
filename.txt
filename
file name.txt

summary.para: Indicates email user names. Examples include the following.

member.name: InputScope.IS_EMAIL_SMTPEMAILADDRESS
member.summary: Indicates a complete SMTP email address, for example, someone@example.com.

member.name: InputScope.IS_LOGINNAME
member.summary:
Indicates a log-in name and domain. The following conditions are enforced.
Allows all IS_ONECHAR characters.
Does not allow domain or username to start or end in a non-alphanumeric character.
Spaces are not allowed.
Examples include the following.
CHICAGO\JSMITH
JSMITH

summary.para: Indicates a combination of first, middle, and last names. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates a honorific or title preceding a name. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates a first name or initial. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates a middle name or initial. Examples include the following.
Indicates a last name. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates a name suffix abbreviation or Roman numerals. Examples include the following.
Indicates a full address, including numbers. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates an alphanumeric postal code. The value is alphanumeric to support international zip codes. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates a house number, street number, apartment name and number, and/or postal box. Examples include the following.
Indicates a full name or abbreviation of state or province. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates the name or abbreviation of a city. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates the name of a country/region. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates the abbreviation of the name of a country/region. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates currency symbols and numbers. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).

member.name: InputScope.IS_CURRENCY_AMOUNT
member.summary: Indicates a numeric value for currency, excluding currency symbols. For example, 2,100.25.

summary.para: Indicates a full date, in a variety of formats. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates a numeric representation of months, constrained to 1-12. Examples include the following.
Indicates a numeric representation of days, constrained to 1-31. Examples include the following.
Indicates a numeric representation of years. Examples include the following.
Indicates a character representation of months. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates a character representation of days. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).

member.name: InputScope.IS_DIGITS
member.summary: Indicates positive whole numbers, constrained to 0-9.

summary.para: Indicates numbers, including commas, negative sign, and decimal. For United States locations, the following conditions are enforced.

item.description: The thousand separator is a comma.
The decimal separator is a period.
Negative numbers are represented with a hyphen without a space, not with parentheses.

summary.para: Indicates a single ANSI character, codepage 1252. For United States locations, this includes the following characters.
ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdEfghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789!"#$%&'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[]^_`{|}~
Indicates a password. IS_PASSWORD is not supported and may be altered or unavailable in the future.
summary.div: Note IS_PASSWORD only indicates the password; it doesn't provide any security around the password. All passwords fields should have text services disabled to maintain password secrecy, and therefore it is not valid to have a password field with an IS_PASSWORD input scope.

summary.para: Indicates a telephone number. Alphabetical input is not allowed. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates telephone country codes. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates telephone area codes. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).
Indicates a telephone number, excluding country or area code. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).

Indicates hours, minutes, seconds, and alphabetical time abbreviations. US English uses the 12 hour clock. Leading zeros are optional for hours but required for minutes and seconds. Hours are constrained to 0-24; minutes and seconds are constrained to 0-59. Examples include the following, formatted for English (United States).

member.name: InputScope.IS_TIME_HOUR
member.summary: Indicates a numeric representation of hours, constrained to 0-24.

member.name: InputScope.IS_TIME_MINORSEC
member.summary: Indicates a numeric representation of minutes or seconds, constrained to 0-59.

member.name: InputScope.IS_NUMBER_FULLWIDTH
member.summary: Indicates full-width number, used for Japanese only. Constrained to full-width numbers and Kanji numbers.

member.name: InputScope.IS_ALPHANUMERIC_HALFWIDTH
member.summary: Indicates half-width alphanumeric characters for East-Asian languages, constrained to half-width alphabetical characters and numbers.

member.name: InputScope.IS_ALPHANUMERIC_FULLWIDTH
member.summary: Indicates full-width alphanumeric characters for East-Asian languages, constrained to full-width alphabet characters and numbers.

member.name: InputScope.IS_CURRENCY_CHINESE
member.summary: Indicates Chinese currency.

member.name: InputScope.IS_BOPOMOFO
member.summary: Indicates Bopomofo characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_HIRAGANA
member.summary: Indicates Hiragana characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_KATAKANA_HALFWIDTH
member.summary: Indicates half-width Katakana characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_KATAKANA_FULLWIDTH
member.summary: Indicates full-width Katakana characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_HANJA
member.summary: Indicates Hanja characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_HANGUL_HALFWIDTH
member.summary: Indicates half-width Hangul characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_HANGUL_FULLWIDTH
member.summary: Indicates full-width Hangul characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_SEARCH
member.summary: Starting with Windows 8: Indicates a search string.

member.name: InputScope.IS_FORMULA
member.summary: Starting with Windows 8: Indicates a formula control, for example, a spreadsheet field.

member.name: InputScope.IS_SEARCH_INCREMENTAL
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for search boxes where incremental results are displayed as the user types.

member.name: InputScope.IS_CHINESE_HALFWIDTH
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for Chinese half-width characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_CHINESE_FULLWIDTH
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for Chinese full-width characters.

member.name: InputScope.IS_NATIVE_SCRIPT
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for native script.

member.name: InputScope.IS_YOMI
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for Japanese names.

member.name: InputScope.IS_TEXT
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for working with text.

member.name: InputScope.IS_CHAT
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for chat strings.

member.name: InputScope.IS_NAME_OR_PHONENUMBER
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for working with a name or telephone number.

member.name: InputScope.IS_EMAILNAME_OR_ADDRESS
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for working with an email name or full email address.

member.name: InputScope.IS_PRIVATE
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for working with private data.

member.name: InputScope.IS_MAPS
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates input scope is intended for working with a map location.

member.name: InputScope.IS_NUMERIC_PASSWORD
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates expected input is a numeric password, or PIN.

member.name: InputScope.IS_NUMERIC_PIN
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates expected input is a numeric PIN.

member.name: InputScope.IS_ALPHANUMERIC_PIN
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates expected input is an alphanumeric PIN.

member.name: InputScope.IS_ALPHANUMERIC_PIN_SET
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates expected input is an alphanumeric PIN for lock screen.

member.name: InputScope.IS_FORMULA_NUMBER
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates expected input is a mathematical formula.

member.name: InputScope.IS_CHAT_WITHOUT_EMOJI
member.summary: Starting with Windows 10: Indicates expected input does not include emoji.

member.name: InputScope.IS_PHRASELIST
member.summary: Indicates a phrase list.

member.name: InputScope.IS_REGULAREXPRESSION
member.summary: Indicates a regular expression.

member.name: InputScope.IS_SRGS
member.summary: Indicates an XML string that conforms to the Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) standard. Information on SRGS can be found at http://www.w3.org/TR/speech-grammar.

member.name: InputScope.IS_XML
member.summary: Indicates a custom xml string.

member.name: InputScope.IS_ENUMSTRING
member.summary: The scope contains the IEnumString interface pointer. The Text Input Processor (TIP) can call to retrieve it.
